I'd like to be able to use a file: url as the source of updates for a feature.  
Worked in 2.x.

I can list the features available:

E:\Eclipse-3.0\M8-ConfigTest\eclipse>e:\eclipse-3.0\jre\bin\java.exe -cp 
startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -data tempwork -applicat
ion org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate -command search -from 
file:E:/Eclipse-3.0/Install-Extras/UpdateSite
Searching on file:E:/Eclipse-3.0/Install-Extras/UpdateSite
"com.ibm.jdg2e.demos" com.ibm.jdg2e.demos 3.0.0

Command completed successfully.

But if I use that site in a feature:
<url>
  <update url="file:E:/Eclipse-3.0/Install-Extras/UpdateSite" label="Local 
update site" /> 
</url>

It fails.  
With the command API:
E:\Eclipse-3.0\M8-ConfigTest\eclipse>e:\eclipse-3.0\jre\bin\java.exe -cp 
startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -data tempwork -applicat
ion org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate -command update -featureId 
com.ibm.jdg2e.tools
Connection Error
Command failed.

Using the user interface:
Connection error dialog is opened with a message:
Network connection problems encountered during search.

Odd....  I had a scenario in which it did not work, and another in which it 
worked.

I also noticed another bug: when it could update, it actually installed all 
the possible updates (there were a few newer versions and patches available).

Related to comment #1: I have made the -version an optional parameter to the 
update command, so one can update to specific version, when multiple newer 
versions are available on the update site.

The original bug has not been solved yet.

I tried reproducing the problem with the latest build (0517) and things worked 
fine, both with updating with the wizard, or command line.

To test, I first installed the root 1.0.0 feature from udpate tests, and 
changed the update url to be


   <url>
      <update label="Optional URL" url="file:/d:/test/optionalSite/"/>
   </url>

The problem you were seeing with stack overfloow on error dialog was a 
ui/jface bug that has been fixed in the recent builds (starting with 0514).
